page.title: 11Keswick's newspaper.
page.content: The Reminder started in 1896. There is one machine which makes the words.It has upper case, lower case and punctuation marks.These are made of hot metal die-casts.The big letters are put into words by hand.Next they are placed in a flattish box which is put into a machine and printed onto paper.They employ 16 people,3 of whom are half time. In the town of Keswick there are nine shops that sell The Reminder.They are also sent by post to Braithwaite, Threlkeld and Rosthwaite.Altogether there are 17 shops that sell the paper.The Reminder was free until 1942 but has now been icreased to 10p.The workers work 37 and a half hours each week making 4000-4300 copies.
